topic.title: HP Helion 2.0 Development Platform: Continuous Integration and Deployment Overview

body.p: Helion Code Engine is a continous integration and delivery system designed for small development teams in the enterprise who are interested in building "greenfield" cloud native apps and deploying them into Helion Development Platform.
Helion CE is based on git version control technologies and automates build, test and deploy cycles so that developers can quickly bring their ideas to life and get customer validation.

More specifically, Helion CE automates unit tests by using the most popular testing frameworks for the supported tech stacks, and it can deploy to specified HDP environments - whether they are testing, staging or production.
We expect this CICD tool to work as catalyst in our customers journey to modern development workflows, as it automates processes that traditionally curb agile development in the enterprise.

ul.li: Automates testing through integration with popular testing frameworks.
Supports Git version control technologies: Github.com, Github Enterprise, and on-premise Git repositories.
Deploy to any specified Helion Development Platform environment: test, staging or production.
Supports applications built on Node.js, Java, and Python.
Sends notifications to popular collaboration software such as HipChat and Flowdock.
Integrates with StormRunner for post-deployment load-testing analysis.
